title.narrative: QUALITY EDUCATION

description.narrative: The education system further improves the quality of learning at the primary and secondary levels, based on an upgraded curriculum and the introduction of more interactive and child-centred classroom practices that support the development of both functional and transferable life skills and competencies, the inclusion of children with disabilities, the effective socialization of both girls and boys and their future adaptation to socioeconomic and climate-change risks., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, all boys and girls in Turkmenistan, especially those with disabilities, equitably enjoy quality inclusive education and learning opportunities that develop their competencies and foster their well-being.

sector.narrative: Digital learning materials and ICT in education
System strengthening - curricula and learning materials design (excluding early-learning / pre-primary)
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities
System strengthening - risk informed programming, including climate, resilience, disaster, conflict, and emergency preparedness

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The education system further improves the quality of learning at the primary and secondary levels, based on an upgraded curriculumand the introduction of more interactive and child-centred classroom practices that support the development of both functional andtransferable life skills and competencies, the inclusion of children with disabilities, the effective socialization of both girlsand boys and their future adaptation to socioeconomic and climate-change risks.

description.narrative: Increased capacity of national education partners on competency-based education, on interactive and child-centered classroom practices, and on inclusion of children with disabilities, as well as stronger knowledge of children on climate-change risks, and enhanced learning with digital education materials, contributed to the initial steps of education system towards quality learning at the primary and secondary levels. | Status:Met | As-of Date:21/01/2022
